intro: Psychotria callithrix, commonly known as the "devil's blood" or "soul of the forest," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical rainforests. Psychotria callithrix is also notable for its association with certain species of epiphytic plants and its role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat.
